header.subtitle: Assess risk, get a vaccine plan, and care steps after a bite/scratch.

ui.openMap: Open map to find nearby clinics
ui.calendarSubtitle: Download the .ics, then open with Google Calendar to import automatically
ui.gcalNote: To add all visits at once, download the .ics and open it with Google Calendar. Links below add visits one by one.

sections.triageSubtitle: Answer a few questions to get guidance aligned with recommendations

feedback.subtitle: Tell us if this was helpful or what we can improve.

services.reportWarning: If the animal shows suspicious signs, notify livestock officials or call the hotline {phone}.

wound.text: Wash the wound thoroughly with soap and running water for at least 15 minutes. Clean, apply antiseptic, and see a clinician for vaccination as needed.

exposures.3: Cat 3: Deep wounds, bleeding, saliva into eye/mouth/wound

obs10d.yes: Animal can be observed for 10 days

messages.cat1NoPEP: Category 1 exposure: Vaccine and RIG are not required
messages.warning: Warning: Timely vaccination prevents rabies 100%. If symptoms develop, rabies is almost universally fatal.
messages.needRIGDetail: Infiltrate into/around all wounds on the same day as vaccine (Day 0)
messages.stopIfObs10d: If the dog/cat remains healthy for 10 days, a clinician may consider stopping the course.

labels.tetanusNone: No tetanus booster needed (≥3 doses within 5 years)

animals.other: Other mammals e.g. monkey, rat, pig

refs.thaiRedCross: Queen Saovabha Memorial Institute (Thai Red Cross). Rabies exposure management guideline (2018)
refs.tetanusThai: ≥3 prior doses within 5 years → none; >5 years → single booster; <3 doses → 0-1-6 series
